snippet: Ten months after staging a coup, Thailand’s junta remains firmly in control with new laws that essentially give it absolute power.
abstract: Thailand's military junta lifts martial law in most of country but maintains new laws that essentially give it absolute power.
lead_paragraph: Ten months after staging a coup, Thailand’s junta remains firmly in control with new laws that essentially give it absolute power.

headline.main: Thailand: Martial Law Lifted, but Junta Retains a Tight Grip
headline.print_headline: Asia; Thailand: Martial Law Lifted, but Junta Retains a Tight Grip

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
